European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries. Things have been stable since June in China, when Google had its business license renewed, Eric Schmidt said Tuesday. "But you never know; it's possible for the government to cause us to not work."
